repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This is #5242 with a twist to support array initialisation with const variable passed to array size.

in detail this PR:
* to overcome MSVC limitations, value is copied directly when const variables are assigned:
  ```cython
  cdef const int b = 5
  cdef const int a = b  # value 5 is used for initialisation of `a` in the generated C code
  ```

* to overcome C limitation, value is copied directly when const variable is used as array size initializer:
   ```cython
   cdef const int a = 5
   cdef float[a] b.         # value 5 is used for array size in the generated C code
   ```

~There are still rough edges that needs to be touched though - see `FIXME` comments in test files.~

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,65 @@
+# mode: run
+
+cdef const int int_constant = 2
+cdef const int int_constant2 = int_constant
+cdef const int int_constant3
+int_constant3 = 5
+cdef const int *pint_constant = &int_constant
+cdef const int int_sum_constant = 50 + 50
+cdef const int int_sum_constant2 = int_sum_constant
+# FIXME:
+# cdef const int int_sum_constant3 = 10 + int_constant

comment_data.body:
The issue is here:

https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/b6e69afa92d30b1ecf8aff47952a1e2772132702/Cython/Compiler/ParseTreeTransforms.py#L247

We need to add following line

```python
while isinstance(declbase, (Nodes.CPtrDeclaratorNode, Nodes.CConstDeclaratorNode)):
```

But cython is then crashing elsewhere so more love is needed here. Is it possible to fix it in next iteration/PR?

+# FIXME:

+# cdef const char *const string3 = "string3"

comment_data.body: Is it possible to not initialize anything here (i.e not pass any of the `if` statements)? And is that a problem?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6265,6 +6267,20 @@ def analyse_types(self, env, use_temp=0):
 
         self.rhs = self.rhs.analyse_types(env)
 
+        if self.lhs.is_name and self.lhs.entry.type.is_const:
+            # const variable can be initialised if:
+            # * we are in module scope
+            # * self.lhs was not assigned before
+            # * self.rhs is literal, const expression or const variable
+            if env.is_module_scope and self.lhs.entry.init is None and (
+                    self.rhs.has_constant_result() or self.rhs.is_literal or self.rhs.is_name and self.rhs.type.is_const):
+                if self.rhs.is_literal:
+                    self.lhs.entry.init = self.rhs.constant_result
+                elif self.rhs.is_name and self.rhs.entry.init:
+                    self.lhs.entry.init = self.rhs.entry.init

comment_data.body: `array_size_initializer` isn't used anywhere else.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -609,10 +609,13 @@ def analyse(self, base_type, env, nonempty=0, visibility=None, in_pxd=False):
             self.dimension = self.dimension.analyse_const_expression(env)
             if not self.dimension.type.is_int:
                 error(self.dimension.pos, "Array dimension not integer")
-            size = self.dimension.get_constant_c_result_code()
-            if size is not None:
+            if self.dimension.type.is_const and self.dimension.entry.visibility != 'extern':
+                size = self.dimension.entry
+                self.dimension.entry.array_size_initializer = True

comment_data.body:
I'm not hugely keen on this.

I wonder if it's be a bit clearer to have two separate attributes (e.g. `_size` and `_size_entry`) then do `if self._size_entry: return self._size_entry.init; else: return self._size`?

But I'm not sure that's so much better.
Fixed.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -609,10 +609,13 @@ def analyse(self, base_type, env, nonempty=0, visibility=None, in_pxd=False):
             self.dimension = self.dimension.analyse_const_expression(env)
             if not self.dimension.type.is_int:
                 error(self.dimension.pos, "Array dimension not integer")
-            size = self.dimension.get_constant_c_result_code()
-            if size is not None:
+            if self.dimension.type.is_const and self.dimension.entry.visibility != 'extern':
+                size = self.dimension.entry
+                self.dimension.entry.array_size_initializer = True

comment_data.body:
We need to have it in earlier stages of analysis to support passing array size:

```cython
cdef const int aa = 2
cdef const int[aa] cc = [1,2]
```

 Otherwise, Cython fails during analyses with following stack:

```python
 File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/PyrexTypes.py", line 2765, in declaration_code
   if self.size is not None:
      ^^^^^^^^^
 File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/PyrexTypes.py", line 2740, in size
   return int(self._size.init)
          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

Maybe there is other (better) place which is evaluated *before* array size analyses. If you know about it let me know.

+            # * self.rhs is literal, const expression or const variable
+            if env.is_module_scope and self.lhs.entry.init is None and (
+                    self.rhs.has_constant_result() or self.rhs.is_literal or self.rhs.is_name and self.rhs.type.is_const):
+                if self.rhs.is_literal:
+                    self.lhs.entry.init = self.rhs.constant_result
+                elif self.rhs.is_name and self.rhs.entry.init:
+                    self.lhs.entry.init = self.rhs.entry.init

comment_data.body:
Oh, my fault. It has a reason and I forgotten. It allows to compile following code:

```cython
cdef const float aa = 2.0 + 3.0
```

to

```c
static float const __pyx_v_2aa_aa = (2.0 + 3.0);
```

comment_data.body:
I made these examples to fail with an error message. BTW add to support of those cases is not difficult. I got only following crash that need to be fixed:

```python
File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/Pipeline.py", line 50, in generate_pyx_code_stage
  module_node.process_implementation(options, result)
File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/ModuleNode.py", line 226, in process_implementation
  self.generate_c_code(env, options, result)
File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/ModuleNode.py", line 543, in generate_c_code
  self.generate_declarations_for_modules(env, modules, globalstate)
File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/ModuleNode.py", line 763, in generate_declarations_for_modules
  self.generate_cvariable_declarations(module, modulecode, defined_here)
File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/ModuleNode.py", line 1406, in generate_cvariable_declarations
  init = entry.type.literal_code(entry.init)
         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/PyrexTypes.py", line 2710, in literal_code
  return '"%s"' % StringEncoding.escape_byte_string(value)
                  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/StringEncoding.py", line 287, in escape_byte_string
  s = _replace_specials(s)
      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
File "/root/dev/cython/Cython/Compiler/StringEncoding.py", line 262, in replace
  return sub(replace_specials, s)
         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

I don't fully undestand that  function. (`escape_byte_string`). Hence, I would like to avoid fixing it in this PR (unless someone who knows better steps in)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
                        error(self.pos, f"Const variable '{self.lhs.name}' is not initialized")
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6265,6 +6266,32 @@ def analyse_types(self, env, use_temp=0):
 
         self.rhs = self.rhs.analyse_types(env)
 
+        if self.lhs.is_name and self.lhs.entry.type.is_const:
+            if self.lhs.entry.type.cv_base_type.is_ptr:
+                # Currently, `cdef TYPE *const ...` is not supported
+                error(self.pos, f"Assignment to const '{self.lhs.name}'")
+
+            elif env.is_module_scope and self.lhs.entry.init is None and (
+                    self.rhs.has_constant_result() or self.rhs.is_literal or self.rhs.is_name and self.rhs.type.is_const):
+                # const variable can be initialised if:
+                # * we are in module scope
+                # * self.lhs was not assigned before
+                # * self.rhs is literal, const expression or const variable
+                if self.rhs.is_literal:
+                    # case of assignment a value: `cdef const float my_var = 2.0`
+                    self.lhs.entry.init = self.rhs.constant_result
+                elif self.rhs.is_name:
+                    # Assignment of const variable: `cdef const int aa = bb`
+                    if self.rhs.entry.init:
+                        # case when variable is initialized: `cdef const int bb = 5`
+                        self.lhs.entry.init = self.rhs.entry.init
+                    else:
+                        # case when variable is not initialized: `cdef const int bb`
+                        error(self.pos, f"Assignment to const '{self.lhs.name}'")

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
```

Unused

```suggestion
        return self.base.analyse(array_type, env, nonempty=nonempty, visibility=visibility, in_pxd=in_pxd)


```

(would rather leave 2 lines)

You first test for `rhs.has_constant_result() or rhs.is_literal`, thus expecting literals to not (necessarily) have a constant result, and then you use `if rhs.is_literal: init = rhs.constant_result`. That seems contradictory.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6285,6 +6287,32 @@ def analyse_types(self, env, use_temp=0):
 
         self.rhs = self.rhs.analyse_types(env)
 
+        if self.lhs.is_name and self.lhs.entry.type.is_const:
+            if self.lhs.entry.type.cv_base_type.is_ptr:
+                # Currently, `cdef TYPE *const ...` is not supported
+                error(self.pos, f"Assignment to const '{self.lhs.name}'")
+
+            elif env.is_module_scope and self.lhs.entry.init is None and (
+                    self.rhs.has_constant_result() or self.rhs.is_literal or self.rhs.is_name and self.rhs.type.is_const):
+                # const variable can be initialised if:
+                # * we are in module scope
+                # * self.lhs was not assigned before
+                # * self.rhs is literal, const expression or const variable
+                if self.rhs.is_literal:
+                    # case of assignment a value: `cdef const float my_var = 2.0`
+                    self.lhs.entry.init = self.rhs.constant_result

commit.message: Dont use initialisation in the separate line
Error out when array dimension is const
Add support for array size initialization
Add support of MSVC and improve tests

title: Allow initialisation of global const variables 2nd attempt
